conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0.
The particle enters the magnetic field exactly at point P.
In the electric field, the particle experiences a vertical downward force F = qE.
The vertical acceleration a is given by a = qE/m.
The horizontal distance traveled by the particle to reach point P is l.
The time t to travel distance l is t = l/v_0.
The vertical velocity component v_y at point P is v_y = qEl/mv_0.
The angle theta between the velocity direction and the horizontal is tan(theta) = qEl/mv_0^2.
Given that theta = 60 degrees, tan(60 degrees) = sqrt(3).
Solving for l gives l = mv_0^2 sqrt(3)/qE.
The distance d from the launch position to point P is the horizontal distance l.
The distance d is d = mv_0^2 sqrt(3)/qE.
